hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali ibn Abi Talib: He used to say in the case of a sister from both father and mother, and a sister from father, and a grandfather, for the sister from father and mother is the half, and for the sister from father is the sixth to complete the two-thirds, and what remained is for the grandfather. And he used to say in the case of a mother, a wife, sisters, and brothers, and a grandfather, for the wife is the fourth, and for the mother is the sixth, and he placed what remained between the sisters, brothers, and grandfather for the male like the share of two females, and he is at the position of a brother except if the sixth of all the wealth is better for him then he gives him the sixth of all the wealth. And he did not inherit a brother's son together with a grandfather, nor a brother of the mother with a grandfather. And he used to say: in the case of a mother, a husband, a sister, and a grandfather, for the husband is the half three, and for the sister three, and for the mother the third two shares, and for the grandfather the sixth, so it became nine, and thus he used to increase the shares in such distributions.
